artist: Artist: Itō Shinsui; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: portrait (bijin-ga); head and torso of woman wearing light purple and white kimono with red and white collar and multicolored obi; blue ground
inscription: 昭和七年七月十五日 {Shōwa shichinen shichigatsu jūgonichi} (July 15th, 1932)
markings: red artist\'s seal: 深水 {Shinsui} | LLC: publisher seal: ワタナベ {Watanabe} | LL: publisher seal: 版権所有　渡邊庄三郎 {hanken shoyū Watanabe Shōzaburō} (copyright Watanabe Shōzaburō) | on back, red seal: 貮百五拾枚絶版　第貮百四拾貮番 {nihyakugojū mai zeppan, dai nihyakuyonjūni ban} (edition of 250, number 242) | red square publisher seal: わたなべ {Watanabe}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Second Collection of Modern Beauties (Gendai bijin shū dai nishū 現代美人集第二輯)
text: no. 17 in the series (envelop says 第十七　舞妓)
title: Maiko Girl
